info.description: Create supply chains to conduct the opium trade in 19th century Qing China.
info.helpText:
Hovering your mouse over any of the three white boxes in the central top edge of the screen will reveal helpful player aids.

SETUP
• Players choose a seat by clicking any "click to sit" buttons, then type in their name and select their desired color in the popup window. Sit down by clicking the green "Go" button.

• After all players have chosen seats,  any one player must click the "Setup" button, click the check box in the popup window, and then click the "Reset the game!" button. This will randomly make one person the starting player and place all initial conspiracy tiles according to the player count.

PLAYER TURN INTERFACE
• Once done with your turn, click the "Click to end turn" button button above your name, which will move to the next player in order. The next player will hear a soft sound and a text alert on screen, reminding them that their turn has begun. Clicking anywhere on the screen will remove the text alert. Any players who do not want to hear the sound and/or see the text alert when it is their turn can click the "Turn Alert Options" button in the bottom-right corner and change their preference.

• Instead of taking a turn, you may pass for the rest of the round by clicking the "Click to Pass" button above your name. Instructions for what you may now do will appear in the recent history box at the top-right corner of the screen. This will automatically increase the indicated cost in the Conspiracy Pools section.

PLAYER BOARD DETAILS
• Click and drag your cube in the "investments" row to spend investments.
• Click and drag the disc in the "R" row to increase or decrease your revenue.
• The revenue cost for each industry is indicated to the left of those tiles. 
• When you purchase a new industry tile, drag it from the holder to the left of your board, and place it anywhere in the white zone to the right of your board. 
• Make an Envoy by click and dragging one of your Merchant tiles onto either "Envoy" square. 
• When placing your Scion, click and drag the tile and drop it into the left-most open space in "The London Season". Click on the tile to rotate it; the value on top is the value of that tile. Click and drag the second Scion tile from the box if you need a value 4-7 tile, and place the lower value tile back in your Scion box.
• Drag all prizes you gain into the box under "Prizes" on your board. The victory point indicator in that box will automatically show the sum of your prize tiles' values as well as points from being an industry leader.
• The number to the left of "Prizes" on your board indicates how many prize tiles you have taken. 

LEADER INDICATORS
This room will automatically indicate which players are industry leaders, and apply 2 points to those players for as long as they are leaders. 

THE LONDON SEASON PEAKING DETAILS
• You may peek at a prize tile by dragging it onto "prize peek" box. This reveals that tile's value only to you. Finish peeking by dragging your tile back to the box it started in, or click the "Rest" button under the "prize peek" box to place all current prize tokens back to their original boxes in The London Season.

• There is a small disc in the top-left corner of The London Season which you may drag under the box with the prize you just peeked. This helps you, and others, remember which prize every player looked at earlier in the round. 

DICE POOL DETAILS
In order to roll and place a new die, click and drag it from the "Dice Pool" box. The die will be automatically rolled. 

CONSPIRACY POOLS & TILES DETAILS
• The current revenue cost for placing a conspiracy tile is shown at the top of this section. This number will match the number of players who have passed within the current round.

• Click and drag conspiracy tiles to play them. Details about your chosen tile will appear in the recent history box at the top-right corner of the screen.

• When you open a port in a region, the coast spaces will be automatically removed along with any smugglers on them. 

• NOTE: The Qing forces counter will NOT automatically increase when new Qing forces are played. Change the counter to match the current Qing forces count on the map by clicking the plus and minus buttons.

REGIONS MAP DETAILS
• When placing industry tiles, click to rotate them. The value at the top is the current value of that tile. 
• Each trading route begins broken, and the black circle "B" next to it indicates this. When a route is complete, click on the "B" to turn it into a "C" to show this. If the route is broken, click on the "C" to revert it back to a "B". Smugglers on completed routes will gain a thin white border to help indicate that they are part of a completed route.  
• When destroying tiles or dice, click and drag them into the trash can icon in the top-right corner of the screen. A counter will track how many tiles are in the trash can, and you may click and drag on the trash can to bring items back out from it.  

ROUND END DETAILS
• End a round by clicking on the "New Round" button in the bottom-right corner. This will increase the round counter, add 1 new conspiracy tile to all eight pools, deal out the correct number of prize tiles to The London Season, reset all players' Scions, and reset all players' investment cubes. 
• The second player to pass in the previous round will have announced their desired play direction for the new round the moment they passed. Click the Downward/Upward Turn Order button in the bottom-right corner to toggle the direction that was announced.

thenRoutine.header: Enter your name and choice of player color.
Enter your name and choice of player color.

elseRoutine.header: Are you sure you want to remove ${PROPERTY player} from this seat?

fields.label: Remove this player from their seat

arguments.addendum: • ${player_name} will be the starting player in the next round.
• ${player_name} must immediately announce the turn order direction (up or down) for the next round.
• The placed smuggler increases demand. Choose 1 die from the pool and place it in Region ${index}.
• The placed smuggler increases demand. Choose 1 die from the pool and place it in Region ${index}.
• Increase Public Outrage by 1, because a British Influence tile was taken.

thenRoutine: var police_addendum = 'One black tile must be removed from the Region with the new Qing tile. Increase Outrage by 2. Check for broken supply chains. At the end of this turn, check chosen regions demand.'

var police_addendum = 'Two black tiles must be removed if possible, and this tile must be placed into a Region where it can remove the most black tiles. Increase Outrage by 2 for each removed black tile. At the end of this turn, check chosen regions demand.'

arguments.addendum: • Increase Qing Forces by 1, because a Qing Force tile was placed. ${police_addendum}
• Choose a Region with a smuggler, or adjacent to a Region with a smuggler. Place the new smuggler into the chosen Region. At the end of this turn, check chosen region's demand.
• Choose a Region adjacent to a Region with a missionary. Place the new missionary into the chosen Region. At the end of this turn, check chosen region's demand.
Currently there is no Merchant Leader.
${player_name} becomes the Merchant Leader, gaining 2vp.

enterRoutine: var coast_remove_seed = 'The coast has been removed'
var coasts_remove_seed = 'The coasts have been removed'

thenRoutine: var coast_remove_string = ${coast_remove_string} + ' along with 1 smuggler. This reduces demand by 1, so return 1 die to the pool at the end of the turn'
var coast_remove_string = ${coast_remove_string} + ' smugglers. This reduces demand by '
var coast_remove_string = ${coast_remove_string} + ' dice to the pool at the end of the turn'

arguments.addendum: • Region ${index}'s port has opened, all players gain opportunity there, and Merchants may be placed in this Region, from now on. Remove the highest ${open_port_count}${open_port_dice_string} from the pool. ${coast_remove_string}.
• The placed missionary increases demand. Choose 1 die from the pool and place it in Region ${index}.
Currently there is no Ship Leader.
${player_name} becomes the Shipping Leader, gaining 2vp.
Currently there is no Opium Leader.
${player_name} becomes the Opium Leader, gaining 2vp.

arguments.addendum: • 5p game: Region A begins with an open port, its coast has been removed, and one die has been removed from the pool. All players gain opportunity there, and Merchants may be placed in this Region. The game begins in Round 2.

info_game_structure_parent.note: The overflow CSS declaration means anything larger than this widget won't be visible.

info_game_structure_asset.note: Make sure to set movable and movableInEdit to false so you can drag around the whole icon.

info_game_structure_icon.note: The pointer-events CSS declaration means it won't stand in the way of the item under it but you also can't select it by clicking on it so you have to find it in the tree. Make sure the z here is greater than the z on the item you're enlarging.
